Summary Passionate about the right content at the right time for the right customer in web services.  
 
I am with Microsoft now. The mission of my team is to develop personalization in Bing search engine. It is fascinating to conduct applied research in machine learning on large-scale data and online experiments with millions of users via interactive web services. 
 
Received my doctoral degree from the National University of Singapore and took postdoc training on machine learning at Gatsby, University College London. Then moved to USA and worked for Columbia University, Yahoo! Labs and now Microsoft.  
 
Big data analytic on Hadoop and Cosmos, experienced developer in C# and C, and R&D team leader 
 
Award-winning researcher, published 40+ papers with h-index 25+ 
http://scholar.google.com/citations?user=3J4zb7gAAAAJ&hl=en

Summary My entire career has involved developing software to manage and analyze large amounts of data, initially geographic data (22 years) and most recently web search data (8 years). 
 
One year ago Microsoft moved my team to a new "discipline": Data and Applied Scientist. Same job as I was previously doing, just a new title. I still code, play with data, and run experiments to find out what moves our metrics. 
 
My ideal job is at the confluence of Big Data, GIS, and Machine Learning. It would involve using data for good, to improve the world, rather than just for profit. It would support a healthy work/life balance in a location with good quality of life. 
 
Specialties: Web Search. Big Data. GIS software development. Local Search and Online Mapping. Data Mining. Machine Learning. Summary Results-driven professional offering a strong balance between business, engineering, and technical savvy. Possess a proven track record of leading the design, development, and production of multi-disciplinary engineering products, with a focus on alternative energy, renewable energy, and industrial manufacturing. Oversee the entire lifecycle of new product development — from conceptualization and R&D to prototyping and testing to transfer for commercialization and manufacturing. Effectively aligns product development activities with corporate goals and client objectives to achieve multiple patents, readily marketable products, and ultimately high ROI. Capitalize on solid engineering, problem solving, and analysis skills to identify and pursue opportunities for improving manufacturing processes and optimizing product quality while reducing overall production costs. Leverage superior communication and interpersonal skills to cultivate strong internal and stakeholder relations. Build and spearhead top-performing, cross-functional teams, providing the tactical direction, guidance, and support to ensure the on time and within budget completion of deliverables that consistently exceed expectations.

* Fuel Cell Product Development: Stack Integration, Applications, Operating Strategies, Balance Of Plant Development, Technical Leadership

Summary I have built large scale distributed software systems in the areas of Recommender Systems, Information Retrieval, Text/Data Mining, and Machine Learning to improve product discovery and selection at Amazon.com.  
 
My technical experience includes developing Recommender systems, machine learning, web crawlers, scrapers, text classifiers, product matching, large scale distributed transaction processing and search engines  
 
Over the years, i have engineered several mining algorithms to improve product pricing. In addition, I enhanced search/browse experience for Amazon.com customers by reducing duplicate search results and finding related product advertisements.  
 
I am also very passionate about hiring and mentoring. I was recognized by my director for my interviewing skills and was nominated and trained to lead interview panels at Amazon.com  
 
At SensorLogic, I was voted the best employee for my leadership and engineering contributions while developing the Machine to Machine (M2M) platform aimed at monitoring soft real time systems.  
 
My career growth can be attributed to  
1. Strong bias towards innovation and algorithmic solutions to difficult problems while keeping things simple. 
2. Consistent delivery of projects with no defects on or before deadline  
3. Maintaining high quality bar for me and my organization 
4. Making data driven decisions

Summary Markus works on Skype Call Quality team committed to drive calling experience at Skype to even higher level. He is one of the key persons designing, implementating and analysing Skype's user facing Call Quality Feedback system and the massive stats it produces. He is co-author of Skype audio hardware specifications (Skype Cert. Audio specs) and creator of Skype TV audio requirements. He is actively involved on audio and video quality, machine learning, quality modeling, testing, SW planning, audio HW, key partners and university co-operations, standardization, and audio lab development. He is very motivated to improve audio quality at Skype with wide perspective. 
 
Specialities:  
- advanced audio testing  
- machine learning and data analysis 
- call quality modeling and statistics 
- User and tech. based audio and video quality requirements, for example Skype TV audio requirements  
- audio lab building & management  
- objective speech quality tools  
- audio research  
- university co-operation  
- standardization  
- audio processing algorithms  
- acoustics competence: room, mobile/small size, transducer - audio training  
- management

Summary In my current role at Microsoft/Skype I develop and optimise algorithms to improve the video experience in Skype for our millions of users. I’m passionate about algorithmic development and system optimization and like driving it all the way from idea to shipping. I also find it rewarding to lead projects within our team.  
 
When I started at Skype in 2006 my focus was on speech coding and speech processing where I among other things worked on Skype’s first proprietary speech codec. Since 2009 I have primarily worked on video coding, processing, quality assessment, and transmission. One of my later efforts was to develop a low-complex low-light enhancement algorithm. The algorithm was shipped on a wide range of platforms during 2013.  
 
I’m an inventor/co-inventor of about 40 patent applications covering areas of speech coding, artificial speech bandwidth extension, robust video coding, forward error correction, video coding, video processing, jitter buffer control, and quality estimation. Experience Principal Applied Scientist, Skype Microsoft July 2014  – Present (1 year 2 months) Palo Alto, CA Machine learning - applications in communication & collaboration. Principal Software Development Engineer, Skype Microsoft October 2011  –  June 2014  (2 years 9 months) Palo Alto, CA Next generation services for Skype, based on cloud architecture. 
 
My key contributions included: 
 
- Trouter: large scale web notification service implemented fully in node.js, and deployed on Windows Azure. It uses socket.io to handle comet and websocket communication. I created an early prototype of the service and then followed through in architecture and software development leading to production release. I co-authored a patent application based on this work. 
 
- Sharks: library for combining together several key-value stores hosted in different data centers in order to create a composite, replicated key-value store of higher reliability, surviving outages of individual data centers. Worked on interesting synchronization properties, better than eventual consistency, under mild quorum write & read assumptions. Developed in C#, using async-await framework. Utilized in production services. Chief Software Architect, Skype Enterprise Skype September 2010  –  October 2011  (1 year 2 months) Palo Alto, CA Web collaboration software for enterprises. 
 
My main accomplishment: defining architecture of a hybrid web and native client for Skype Enterprise. The client aimed to bridge the legacy Skype peer to peer architecture with next generation cloud architecture. Much of the complexity and finesse was in arranging inter-working between web and native domains of the client to meet various requirements that go beyond the needs of standard web applications. I authored two patent applications based on this work. Software Architect, Reuters Messaging Thomson Reuters September 2006  –  August 2010  (4 years) New York City, NY Web collaboration software for financial industry. 
 
My main accomplishment: creating a next generation communication platform for Reuters Messaging. It was called Web Collaboration Platform and it was a radical departure from and modernization of the legacy architecture of Reuters Messaging based on SIP and Microsoft Lync platform. Distinguishing features of the Web Collaboration Platform included: single unifying abstraction of a collaboration channel, focus on HTTP web services, web friendly JSON data format, real time web notifications using a dedicated web push service based on comet, open source components, primarily Java jetty. Above all, the architecture addressed an intersection of synchronous and asynchronous modes of messaging, unifying traditionally separate applications of Instant Messaging and persistent chat rooms under one roof. I defined architecture of this new technology, and worked with a small team on developing it and deploying at Reuters Messaging as a complement and in many instances a replacement of the legacy SIP / Lync architecture. WCP currently carries a traffic load on the same level as the original legacy platform. 
 
I also contributed as architect to other projects at Reuters Messaging, including web messenger (AJAX, web services accessed via XHR, comet), integration of web messenger with Thomson Reuters trading platforms (Single Sign On among other requirements), and compliance service for Reuters Messaging. Senior Software Engineer Telcordia Technologies 1999  –  2006  (7 years) piscataway, nj Telecommunication systems software, Internet communication software. 
 
I worked in a technology incubation team, developing software prototypes for new telecommunication products of Telcordia. The example contributions included: 
 
- Architecture and a corresponding software prototype for Converged Communication Services, a Java web services platform that allows building various applications on top of PSTN, such as a TV telecom portal, an application executing in a TV set top box. It offered features such as TV caller ID, call logs, click to call, interactive call routing using a TV remote etc. 
 
- Services controlling dual mode WiFi and cellular phones. The service handled registration on either network, and seamless mid-call hand-offs between the networks, based on the strength of the signal. This technology was based on Java and SIP servlets.  
 
- Web application allowing a quick transition from a phone call to a web conference. I received a US patent for the idea, as a co-author. 
 
- Enhanced services on top of Telcordia MGCP-based softswitch. 
 
- Enterprise broadcast application, using web services combined with IP multicast, based on .NET and Windows Media Services. Senior Software Engineer Melita International 1995  –  1999  (4 years) Norcross, GA Telecommunication systems software, Computer Telephony Integration, call center applications. 
 
C++ development for PC-based telecom server, utilized in call center applications. The platform used Dialogic and other CTI boards. This was a distributed CORBA environment, with a cluster of servers. My main accomplishment was in design and implementation of a distributed connection broker service that managed audio connections between geographically distributed servers, utilizing Asynchronous Transfer Mode (ATM) technology, a precursor to VoIP.
